name: GitHub
description: Access GitHub data including repositories, issues, pull requests, and user information

about.overview: The GitHub REST API allows developers to interact with GitHub programmatically, providing access to repositories, issues, pull requests, users, organizations, and other GitHub resources. It enables automation of workflows, integration with other tools, and the ability to build applications that extend GitHub's functionality.
useCases: Building CI/CD integrations and development tools
Creating custom dashboards for project management
Developing GitHub Apps and OAuth applications

codeSnippets.python:
from github import Github
g = Github('PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN')
repo = g.get_repo('octocat/hello-world')

quickStart: Create a GitHub account at https://github.com/join
Generate a personal access token at https://github.com/settings/tokens
Use the token for authentication in API requests

authentication.description: Include your token in the Authorization header as 'token YOUR_TOKEN'
